hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversion After News-Driven Spikes
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a >5% intraday price spike on negative macro news (US budget crisis, liquidity crash narratives), the subsequent 24-48 hours will show mean reversion of -2% to -4% as algorithmic liquidity providers re-enter and absorb the overreaction.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Negative news spikes in neutral/bear regimes often represent panic selling into thin liquidity, creating temporary gaps that market makers and algorithmic traders quickly fill. The positive funding rate indicates over-leveraged long positioning that needs to be unwound.
entry_conditions: BTC 1-hour price spike >5% within 2 hours of negative macro news headline
Cumulative funding rate across top 5 exchanges turns positive >0.01%
Total crypto market cap remains below pre-spike level

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 70% of the initial spike magnitude

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such spikes continue trending in same direction beyond 48 hours without mean reversion
